Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i need to call it a day, but we made fantastic progress. it seems this extra emission problem is solvable if we can just make it easier for the higher hash rate to solve, or maybe just boost it a bit regardless if these triggers are happening. maybe at least a certain amount that would compound quickly should just be added to the diff and not decay totally away with tipdiff

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the good new is that simple 15 core CPU mining duplicates the bug

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: currently the solve times are slowed down, but that slows down the diff growth, even as the hashrate is constant and at 15x starting levels

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it might be as simple as just boosting the diff 10% each time tipdiff is triggered? not sure if that is fast enough, but to compensate for the slowdown due to tipdiff
